question: Using a finite summation, compute the  initial deflection at midspan for the beam in  Figure P8.42. Given: E = 3000 kips/in.2 .  Use 3-ft segments. Assume I = 0.5IG. <image 1>
description:
The image depicts a structural engineering problem involving a cantilever beam with a load applied at point B. The beam is anchored at point A and extends horizontally to point B, where it changes direction and continues downward at an angle. The dimensions provided are as follows:

- The horizontal segment from A to B is 8 feet long.
- The inclined segment from B to the end of the beam is 12 feet long.
- The vertical distance from the horizontal segment to the end of the inclined segment is 9 feet.
- There is a spring support at the end of the inclined segment with a stiffness \( k = 5 \) kips/in.

A concentrated load of 30 kips is applied vertically downward at point B.

The question asks to compute the initial deflection at midspan for the beam using a finite summation method, given the modulus of elasticity \( E = 3000 \) kips/in\(^2\) and assuming \( I = 0.5I_G \), where \( I_G \) is the moment of inertia of the gross section. The calculation should use 3-foot segments.
